relevant_findings.mass_description: A mass, 12 cm in diameter, present in the right breast; it extended from the areola and involved much of the upper outer quadrant and was fixed to the chest wall.
relevant_findings.lymph_nodes: Mobile lymph nodes in the axilla.
relevant_findings.skin_changes: The overlying skin was erythematous and edematous with peau d’orange change.
relevant_findings.discharge: No discharge from the nipple or ulceration of the skin.
relevant_findings.left_breast: The left breast and the remainder of the examination were normal.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The next day, MRI of the right breast showed enlargement of the dominant mass to 7.1 cm in the greatest dimension, indicating progression.

relevant_findings.mass_description: MRI of the breast after four cycles of neoadjuvant chemotherapy revealed a decrease in enhancement and size of the dominant mass to 3.0 cm in greatest dimension.
relevant_findings.skin_changes: Resolution of skin thickening was noted.
relevant_findings.lymph_nodes: Resolution of axillary lymphadenopathy was also observed.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The imaging study revealed a decrease in the size and level of enhancement of the mass, indicating improvement.
